alert.note: Alert for Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 7:21AM CDT until July 14 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occuring. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Canadian, Cleveland and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 AM CDT, emergency management, trained spotters, and local media reported ongoing flooding from thunderstorms earlier this morning across the Oklahoma City metro. Flooding is occurring and will likely continue for the next two hours even through rainfall has ended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Yukon, Bethany, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Noble, Piedmont, Slaughterville, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Nicoma Park, Valley Brook and Etowah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
